title: Environments: activation does not work with custom config. path

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Environment activation does not work correctly when using Spack with a custom configuration path (`-C ...`).

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack -C /home/user/config env activate /home/user/env
```

### Error Message

```console
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-08-26-13:10:10.769115] Imported env from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-08-26-13:10:10.772811] Imported env from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/cmd/env.py:97 ==> [2020-08-26-13:10:10.774248] This command works best with Spack's shell support

  
  To initialize spack's shell commands:
  
      # for bash and zsh
      . /home/user/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
  
      # for csh and tcsh
      setenv SPACK_ROOT /home/user/spack
      source /home/user/spack/share/spack/setup-env.csh
  
  Or, if you want to use `spack env activate` without initializing
  shell support, you can run one of these:
  
      eval `spack env activate --sh /home/user/env`   # for bash/sh
      eval `spack env activate --csh /home/user/env`  # for csh/tcsh
```

The environment can activate correctly if I remove the `-C ...` option.


### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-656-3c86629
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-haswell


### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
